column2: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|a letter]] to [[Alina Dadlez]]'''.<ref name=G>{{CG|C}}

column1: *'''Subject:''' Reply to a letter from Dadlez (of [[3 July]])
column2: who had forwarded a copy of a letter concerning a translation into Spanish of ''[[The Hobbit]]'' (see '''''[[El hobito]]''''').<ref name=G/>

column1: {{blockquote|[Tolkien wishes] ''[[hobbits|hobbit]]'' to remain untranslated (as a protection against the private fancies of translators ... ). In a Latin language ''hobbits'' looks dreadful
column2: and if I had been earlier consulted I would have readily agreed to some naturalization of the form
column4: which consorts better with the long-adopted ''elfos''
column5: while having the good fortune to contain the normal Sp[anish] diminutive suffix
column7: which as far as I know has no associations in Spanish.|<ref name=G/><ref>{{CG|RG}}

column1: In the words of [[Christina Scull]] and [[Wayne G. Hammond]]
column2: Tolkien also apologizes to Dadlez for "not replying sooner
column3: but mail had not been forwarded despite his arrangements"
column4: and writes that the "most important point to make to the translator of ''The Hobbit'' into Spanish is that if he uses ''gnomos'' for [[dwarves]]
column5: it must not be used in the phrase 'the [[elves]] that are now called [[gnomes]]'".<ref name=G/>
